overview: From 2025-08-12 to 2025-08-13, ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topPRs.title: perf(retries): Intermittent failures slowing down dev workflow, implement retries for forge scripts
topPRs.author: blmalone
topPRs.body: We're seeing persistent 502 errors when we run the justfile command `simulate-all-templates` in CI. After some debugging, we believe the error is upstream in GCP. Therefore, we're going to implement a simple retry attempt on our end. We only need this for the `simulate` step in the `justfile`.

topContributors.summary: janjakubnanista: Focused on development work, opening PR #17030 "feat: Local op-geth images for kurtosis" in ethereum-optimism/optimism, and made 9 commits modifying 16 files (+51/-27 lines) primarily in configuration files, with a focus on other work and bug fixes.

arisarcmarket: Focused on expanding network capabilities by opening a PR to add an ARCv2 token to the Base network (ethereum-optimism/ethereum-optimism.github.io#1184), and also provided a review comment on another pull request.
nonsense: Focused on other work, opening a PR in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#17024) to remove a driver step event, reflecting their code changes across 5 files.

blmalone: Focused on performance improvements, opening a PR in ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops (#1161) to address intermittent failures impacting developer workflows, reflecting a primary focus on other work.
yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on strategic coordination, evidenced by the creation of issue ethereum-optimism/optimism#17027 to coordinate GTM tasks for Flashblocks public enablement.
serpixel: Today, serpixel initiated work on porting acceptance tests by creating issue ethereum-optimism/infra#444, indicating a focus on test coverage and system interoperability.
